alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 5:55PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Arizona, including the following county, Coconino. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 554 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Walnut Creek and San Francisco Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Flagstaff, Walnut Canyon National Monument Flagstaff Mall, Foxglenn Park, Macann Estates, Pioneer Valley, Fisher Point, Mt. Elden, Sunnyside, Buffalo Park, Pine Canyon, Northern Arizona University, and Thorpe Park. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 198 and 210. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 419 and 420. Route 66 between mile markers 197 and 204. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
